reviews.review_msg: Dr. Wright is amazing! He genuinely cares about his students, course materials are extremely organized, and consistent and engaging in his teaching style. Probably one of the best profs I met in psych department

Dr. Wright's lectures are very engaging, and it's evident he cares profoundly about what he teaches. He is very approachable, and I've never had an issue asking him questions. However, the TAs are hard markers. MAKE SURE to attend their office hours if you are not happy with a grade, as we were not given a clear grading rubric for any assignments.

I have never encountered a prof who so clearly cares about his students. I asked Dr. Wright one question via email- he then invited me to speak with him after class, he gave me rich advice and spent nearly an hour just talking to me. His lectures cover interesting topics in a very straightforward, easy to understand, way. thank you, Dr. Wright

Dr. Wright knows what he's talking about and his lectures were really informative. His expectations for his evaluations were clear and he genuinely cares about how you are doing and wants to help. As the other reviews say, he does tend to ramble, but I still found him engaging.

He is a nice guy but he rambles about his own political opinion on different matters too much, sometimes, it seems like he's reaching to make a point. The lectures are long but overall enjoyable as he is interesting to listen to. The midterm is written, final is multiple choice. The group project is atrocious if you get into a bad group.

Steve is amazing! The lectures can be long as he tends to ramble, but the content was easy to understand. Make sure that you keep up with the readings as they are quite lengthy. His midterm consisted of short answers only but it is doable and he gives you at least 10 days to prepare as you only need to answer some of them during the exam.

Decent class, nice prof, just needs to have better time management (prolonged lectures). Biggest problem with this class was its poor inter-rater reliability. The two TAs took turns grading your different assignments but one of them marked CONSISTENTLY harder than the other which led to pretty big discrepancies between grades. Very frustrating.

Lectures were long-winded (often without breaks) and Dr. Wright regularly was not able to finish the slides in time. Attendance was mandatory and audio recordings were only accessible with permission. HUGE disparity of marking between TAs and little feedback was given (if any). The content was valuable, but the class design was frustrating.

Had really high expectations for this course as I heard good things about it but was kind of disappointed. The prof is really nice and passionate about the subject, but lectures felt really drawn out and unclear. Big discrepancy in the marking between the 2 TA's -- a lot of students noticed this. Super average experience with a lot of assignments.

Nice guy, cares a lot about the subject, but bad with time management. We almost never finished the lecture slides and were constantly running behind. Gave one 10-minute break during 3-hour lectures -- hard to keep energy and attention up. Group project spanned entire semester but wasn't that work-heavy. Good class, but frustrating.

I was disappointed. Stephen is a really nice guy and he's pretty funny, but his lectures (especially in the second half) were extremely long and dry.

He also stopped giving breaks and at some point everyone stopped listening, but he kept going because he was behind on his teachings.

Rambles WAY TOO MUCH. It becomes hard to understand his point.

Dr. Wright is an awesome prof. So kind. There are lots of ways to earn marks in this class and I really liked the format of the midterms and final. Group project isn't that bad and doesn't require a lot of work. Lectures could be done in half the time if there was less rambling which is kinda annoying, but I definitely recommend him!

Steve is a solid prof! He's passionate about the coursework and wants you to succeed. He makes time to chat and will answer questions as quickly as possible. He's funny, but his lectures can feel a bit long sometimes. Grading is fair for the most part. This course is interesting and builds on topics most of us already have some understanding of.

Probably one of the best PSYC instructors in the faculty! Recorded lectures were great, the zoom seminar/discussions were engaging and he's really fun to converse with. Would really like to have him as instructor again. Other than the tests, readings don't really come up in lecture/discussions.

A caring prof who is very passionate and knowledge. Lectures were engaging as he incorporates personal examples. Group project wasn't bad. If you want to do well on the papers focus on grammar (lots of marks taken away if its not smooth).
Steve is the most caring and passionate professor I have ever encountered at SFU. Being his student is life changing. Would definitely recommend anyone to take his class.

Dr. Wright is absolutely incredible. His are the probably the best university lectures I have experienced, as they are extremely engaging and contain powerful, valuable, and thought provoking information. His teaching and expectations are clear, helpful, fair, and informative. Concepts learned will stay with you long term and change you for better.

Steve is a very caring prof. Makes lectures interesting and is very accessible outside of class. 3 midterms, 2 short papers, and a few inclass assignments make up your grades. Exams are short: 10 M/C and 2 S/A. Textbook is not that bad to read and it is easy to follow his lecture slides in class. Would recommend if you need a UD PSYC class.

The best prof at SFU! Loves his job and rather than make students memorize unnecessary stuff, makes sure you leave the course with some useful info in the context of social psyc! You have to attend classes
Clear lectures, well-explained concepts, and Dr. Wright is obviously very passionate about what he teaches/studies.

Literally one of my favourite profs at SFU. Dr. Wright is amazing! He definitely knows his stuff and his lectures are very organized. He keeps the class interesting and gives you various opportunities to do well (e.g., 2 papers, 2 midterms, & final), so percentages are distributed well. I would take every class with him if I could!

One of the better Lecturers I've had at SFU in a long time.  I don't understand how he can continue his lecturing pace and remain super clear and consistent - experience, I suppose.  Important class to take, even if you are not a psychology major.  If you come to class, with moderate effort and decent notes you'll do well.
Memorize everything
Final is difficult and got papers to write. However, there are activities in class which is easy to get marks.

Didn't find the content that interesting, but he's passionate about the material which makes lectures easy to sit through. In-class assignments so participation is mandatory. Papers are pretty easily marked but tests are a bit tougher. Make sure to take good notes in class and you should be fine

Go to class cuz it counts as attendance. His lectures&topics are very useful&relevant. I highly recommend psyc363 with Wright if ur interested in the psychology behind intergroup relations. His lectures feels long cuz he talks really fast and there's no break btwn. Exams are harder than u think, but he gives essay Qs beforehand. Papers are ok.

Funny Prof. Tends to ramble on and takes forever to get through lectures. Great if you like learning about Racism, Discrimination, Prejudice. 2 small essays and 2 fairly short, easy midterms. Final was all MC. Overall would Recommend

First time seen him in his office hour, he rambles on and on, but later I found he is so enthusiastic about his class and is the most enlightening professor I have at SFU. Absolutely adorable and easy to approach.

Really an eye-opening course, if ur interested in prejudice, privilege, racism, etc you'll like the class. Stephen is enthusiastic and friendly, but tends to ramble and sometimes makes me fall asleep. the course content is valuable and applicable to life; exams/assignments are straightforward. Go to office hours! TAs are awesome.
You have to, have to! stay on top of your essays and take notes during the lecture as it will be your guide to a great mark

Honestly one of the best classes i'v ever taken at SFU. But yea, the grading system is a little unfair, I got away with a C+ but I know I got around 83~87%, in other courses, i wouldve gotten a B-? Anyways, take the course!

TAKE THIS CLASS! TAKE THIS CLASS! If you need your 200 level requirement for psyc degree, GO ENROLL RIGHT NOW!!! He's an AMAZING prof, you learn SO much, keeps you engaged, he makes everything crystal clear and exams are exactly what he teaches! GO ENROLL! you will NOT be disappointed. Records his lecture too. You will get at least a b+

Very nice, funny and smart prof. Made lectures funny and explained content to such a high degree that he usually ran out of time (which was kinda bad because we sometimes never went over it) make sure you see him or a TA for the 2 essays to fully understand the topics, most ppl didnt and got a C-

My favourite prof, I want to take more classes with him! He's hilarious, knowledgable, helpful, clear,  great at explaining and keeping things interesting.  Most of all, the marking is very fair (with exception to one TA, Norann) and if you disagree with your mark you can appeal it. Highly recommend this prof and class!
Funny, very enthusiastic professor. I loved going to his classes. His passion for social psychology really shows. Spend time on papers + read textbook!

He's not bad, but not as awesome as people say. He goes around in circle too much and goes off topics a lot of times, at the end, we didn't have time to cover TWO chapters! And the word limit on his papers are just ridicolous, and TA is very biased in their marking. But he explain really well and the class has some very interesting topics.
Amazing prof.. Fair exams/essays/assignments, just do the work & you'll be fine. Unfortunately grading scale is tough! a D is 60%-69%, beware of that!

Steve Wright is an intellectual who truly loves what he does. His lectures are very clear and hard NOT to understand. He is genuinely interested in people and is always willing to talk to you and help you in any way possible. Extremely nice guy, can honestly say he is the reason I am focusing in Social Psychology. Favourite professor at SFU.

loved this prof! he was soo good and make everything even more interesting. great teaching style and enjoyable class! exams were very fair, 2 easy papers and simple assignments that are done in 5 minutes basically free marks.. great class

Amazing prof. makes the lectures fun and interesting so its easy to pay attention. Exams are fairly easy as long as you review lecture slides and keep up with readings. He's hilarious so its not painful to sit through a 2 hour lecture and gives lots of notice before assignments and papers are due.
3 words: BEST. PROF. EVER!
Simply best prof in the entire SFU. If he was a little bit taller, I'd probably go for him :) Kidding. But he is helpful, trying to grade everyone UP and not down for scaling.
great prof. really prepares his students for any assignments, papers, and even exams. havent had a prof help out his class so much.
Best prof ever. He should teach a course to other profs about how to be good profs. That is all.

he's the best prof I've experienced so far!!! he doesn't "just" talk about what's in the text and on the slides; it's mostly his experiences, ideas, and study. He's not only hilarious but extremely cares about students and tries to help as much as possible.

Amazing professor! Keeps you engaged in the material and uses many examples of real-world studies. Only complaint is that he spends too much time on one slide. Otherwise, the class is easy, the textbook is interesting to read, and his exams are also easy - I got A's on both the midterm and final, and I never get A's on psych exams!

i love him!He's the best prof ever!He's funny and engages the audiences very well!Shows lots of interest and affections towards this course.Very honest guy too!Explain everything very detail & lots of examples as well!He is very friendly & helpful.Easy marks for the assignements!! His markings were fair!And he is super funny!!! Thats the best!

I have never seen a teacher who so honestly wants his students to do well. Prof. Wright has an obvious, honest, and unrelenting passion for social Psychology that is infectious. His method of teaching is the clearest I've ever come across. The one thing I'd like to see changed: the textbook. The lectures seem to be more important, GO TO CLASS.

Worst professor ever. The reason why his lecture seems so short is because he talks about same thing over and over again. His notes sucks and doesnt make any sense. Lecture recording only available when u sign up, which is inconvinient when u really need it. His exams r tricky and so much wordings in mutiple choice questions. My biggest mistake eve

A great all-round professor. His lectures are entertaining and he engages the audience well.  Great sense of humour. His interesting analogies will ensure you never fall asleep and he makes 1.5 hours seem like 30 mins! One note however, he does try to impose his political views on the students.
awesome prof, very engaging speaker, see him outside of class for good advice

Honestly, very tough to get anything above an A-. I have a high gpa and so do many of the people I know, but we are all frustrated with the marking system. So it is not the course content that is hard, in fact it is really easy but the marking system is unfair and SOME of the TA's can be tough markers (for the papers).
Interesting lectures, most of the exam is from lecture material. Horrible marking system, do not like it even though I did well in the class.

Lectures are often boring.  The guy chews gum every class, sometimes hard to understand with all the "chomp, chomp, chomp"  (kind of gross) but he is nice and really helpful.  Resonds fast to questions (emails).  You have to really study the text to do good on exams.
Probably the Best Prof I've ever had... he has a passion for what he's talking about.. it's great.

A very entertaining prof. Unlike others, I had no problem with the grading system, because the tests are SO straightforward. Study both the text and the lecture notes. Lectures for a long time on the subject of prejudice, at the expense of other subjects, but that's understandable as that's his area of research.

Make sure you have your coffee and go to the can before class, as his lectures can be repetative, and you only have a 5min break. Good stories, funny guy, marking system is fair. If the highest exam mark is 55/60, than that person gets a 100%, than letter grades are distributed from that mark.

I'M SORRY BUT HE HAS THE WORSE GRADING SYSTEM EVER. REALLY IF YOU WANT TO DO BAD THEN TAKE THIS CLASS BECAUSE IF YOU'RE EXPECTING TO GET EVEN A B-, YOU'D NEED 80%. DON'T GO IN ASSUMING YOU CAN GET A B- WITH 70% BECAUSE YOU'D END UP GETTING A C-. SO UNREASONABLE!

Really interesting/funny prof. But he keeps repeating simple concepts and giving 500 examples for everything - so it takes him forever to get through one slide. Tests were easy, i got 93% and that's an A- apparently? :S The way he scales the grades is the one really bad thing about this prof.

You are gauranteed to laugh out loud every class-he's hillarious. However, he tries to cram way too much info into each class and is quite disorganized, but he does make a really uninteresting subject more fun and you won't fall asleep cuz he runs back and forth flailing his arms and speaks really loudly.

I'm shocked at the amount of people who don't seem to mind his grading system. Those of you must not realize that having an 80% class average and an easier exam is not better if the letter grades distributed for those scores are lower. It's the letter grade that goes towards your GPA and what matters in the end, not the percent! Think about it...

He is HORRIBLE! He rambles on way too much about nothing, and doesn't take breaks on time. He knows the material is easy, so he came up with a ridiculously unfair marking scheme. His grading scale hurts you more than it helps. 60% is a pass, and only 95% is an A! I will never take him again and don't recommend that anyone else does either.

I thought Steven was an awesome prof. Although it might seem ridiculous that an A is 95%, his exams were designed to be easy. Therefore, the class average is in the mid 80 percent tile. I would definately recomment taking another class with him!

he's an alright person.....not rude or anything...but his marking scheme was totally stupid...and A is like 95% or higher.... and he didn't tell us until after the midterm was marked.... he rambled on and on about his kid... can be boring at times....dont know if i'll take another course with him..

god, this guy was not so good. his marking scheme was rediculus, scaled WAY up so an A is only 95% and above or something like that. Also, his stories went all of the place and were way too frequent and redundant.  I wouldnt take anothe class with him.

The tutorials were better than the lectures. He is all over the place with his stories!  Tests were fairly easy but his marking scheme was crazy! He should have looked into marking on the curve BEFORE the midterm. Don't know if I'll take any more Psych courses with him again.

good prof who knows the material well. his grading scheme is higher cuz he aims for 85% avg whereas other profs go for 70-75% avg, but he only explained this AFTER the midterm. tutorials were a waste of time & i only went for the attendance & participation marks.

Great guy, kind,helpful.Passionate about his subject, makes it interesting w/fun stories. Tutorials were ok. Very willing to help you & responded to emails promptly. Recommend him highly.Marking a bit strange but he explains it.

great professor, really funny and interesting. teaches from the text and uses power point. Tutorials are a waste of time but the class itself is interesting. I would definitely take one of his classes again.
good guy. talks a lot about very little, but at least makes it interesting with bizzare examples. Tests are really easy.

He's an awsome teacher!! Will try and help you as much as he can as long as you make your self known to him. He is very pasionate about his field and does an excellent job. You'll love the guy! Highly Recomended

AWESOME, AWESOME prof! I want to take all of his courses! Lecture style is very interesting, course material itself is very intersting. Grading scheme is wacko though, but you will do well on his exams. AWESOME!!
